intro: Herzogia odorifera, commonly known as the sweet-scented moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. The plant emits a faint, pleasant aroma, which is believed to be a natural defense mechanism against herbivores. Herzogia odorifera plays a role in soil stabilization and contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
